title: Even if it's not on Urgot anymore, I think Hyper Kinetic Position Reverser should be reused.
body:
It really is just too cool of a spell to throw away.

I do like his new ultimate, but the feeling of dumping the enemy carry right next to a Leblanc while fearing away their team is just great.

Slap on a new name, maybe swap out the fear for something else if it doesn't fit the aesthetic you are going for, and put it on a new champion.

replies.body: I think it's pretty likely that it, or a very similar spell, ends up on a kit at some point. Completely agree it's a sweet ability, just gotta get it onto the right champ.

i would just point out that this spell would create a very uninteresting gameplay because:

either you use it on a tank, and thus it ends up imbalanced because you swap a carry for a tank

or it's a squishy support, and then you get an uninteresting gameplay like VEngeful Spirit in dota2, where her kit is like karthus and is balanced around dying everytime

I have 5W 1L as teemo support so far in ranked ~~and 0W 1L as teemo top, only cuz i play top about once every 3 patches when i dont get support~~. Prob will stop playing teemo support when cait gets nerfed tho.

I understand he can be a major counterpick to Marksman, but you must take into account the enemy Support too, and how they are gonna scale into the game.

I mean, a good Morgana can be a nightmare for Teemo as she can shield his blind, engage on him and his ADC all game long. Karma loves wars of attrition, especially with squishy champions that have no sustain. Hook champions tend to murder him with their chain CC and not-blinded ADC's damage.

I don't say Teemo Support isn't good, just that he looks like an extremely niche pick, with very few match-ups where I consider it to be safe to pick him. Bot Lane tends to be a clown fiesta in the last few seasons...

Though I imagine catching enemy Ults in a portable hole and then dumping them on the enemy ADC's face Mister Game and Watch style would probably result in some rage.
Redirect projectiles huh? I like that

Sounds like an even more obnoxious Yasuo windwall that'd have to be an ultimate ability. Perhaps if the ability applied to only single target skillshots, then it could be interesting. 

But redirecting things like Ezreal and Jinx ultimates, or Heimerdinger's E ultimate, is going to get very broken very quickly. But the idea of redirecting an Ahri charm, Elise cocoon, Ezreal Q etc if it was to hit could be an interesting mechanic, and relatively harmless.

Think more like Braum's shield against a single enemy champ's projectile.  Once cast you pop up a portal for half a second and catch the first projectile that touches your model.  You can cast it again two more times over the next (duration) seconds.  If you catch three enemy projectiles, you can activate the portal a fourth time to vomit a bunch of damage/CC on medium range target.

Plenty of counterplay both as and against, I would say.

Tbh, his current ult is nothing more than a spammable "_I need instant damage reduction_" ability without using any logic of messing with the targeted enemy's position. At least the new one really fits him well.

The position change is the primary function of the spell; you can initiate a fight by getting the enemy carry instakilled. 

The damage reduction is only there so you don't meet their same fate.
The damage reduction is soooooo much more than that. It basically wins 1v1s if you time it before the enemy's Big Damage Ability (tm).
isnt his W basically the same thing?

Uh, no. Not remotely.

His current ultimate suppresses, swaps positions, and then fears around Urgot, giving damage reduction.

The new W is a shield with a machine gun attached.
Maybe he meant his E. 'Course, still not the same.

the move where he dashes in and throws the opponent behind him. i would consider that a position exchange. it doesnt suppress or fear, but if used in conjunction with the R move it's pretty much the same thing. the R suppresses opponents that are at the execution threshold and it fears all nearby enemies once they're killed. so if you use the R and then dash into them to throw them behind you into your turret and then press R again to execute them it works the same way only the kill is guaranteed.

and there's the added bonus that the dash is a dash and not just a targeted spell. so it can be used on its own and it's a basic ability so it can be used more often.
It should be given to a tank support since it can operate as a sacrificial move.

I'd actually be hesitant about that.

Giving a support suppression/swap is immensely powerful. Not to mention in a scenario where you trade kills, trading the ADC/fed carry for the support is an almost 100% win in most circumstances.
